5300.name: The Great Eastern Desert
5300.description:
A vast desert stretches for miles, the sands constantly shifting around
you. Rising out of the sand to the north you see a mighty pyramid. The
ground is soft underfoot. The air is fresh and clean.

north.description: The sands of the desert continue onward towards the pyramid.

east.description: Sand as far as the eye can see.

south.description: Sand as far as the eye can see.

west.description: Sand as far as the eye can see.

5301.name: At The Base Of The Pyramid
5301.description:
The mighty pyramid towers above out of the hot desert sands, made
from huge blocks of stone that have been coated over with a rough sandy
plaster-like substance. The face of the pyramid is steep, but you think
you might be able to climb it. Wildflowers dot the landscape. Tall grass
sways in a gentle breeze.

south.description: Sand as far as the eye can see.

up.description: The steep slope of the pyramid rises up before you.

5302.name: Climbing The Great Pyramid
5302.description:
Hot air rises off the sides of the pyramid, and the wind chokes you with
a flurry of sand and dust. So far you have made it halfway up the side.
The walls of the pyramid are quite steep. Snow clings to shadowed
crevices. Bare rock dominates the landscape.

north.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the northern side.

south.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the southern side.

up.description: It looks too dangerous to try to climb any higher.

down.description: Far below you are the burning sands of the desert.

5303.name: Climbing The Great Pyramid
5303.description:
Hot air rises off the sides of the pyramid, and the wind chokes you with
a flurry of sand and dust. The walls of the pyramid are quite steep, and
The area is having trouble keeping from sliding down into the sands
below. The air is thin and cold at this altitude. The wind howls around
exposed peaks.

east.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the eastern side.

west.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the western side.

up.description: It looks too dangerous to try to climb any higher.

down.description: This side of the pyramid has a dangerous drop before the sandy floor.

5304.name: Climbing The Great Pyramid
5304.description:
Hot air rises off the sides of the pyramid, and the wind chokes you with
a flurry of sand and dust. The walls of the pyramid are quite steep, and
The area is having trouble keeping from sliding down into the sands
below. The wind howls around exposed peaks. Snow clings to shadowed
crevices.

east.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the eastern side.

west.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the western side.

up.description: It looks too dangerous to try to climb any higher.

down.description: This side of the pyramid has a dangerous drop before the sandy floor.

5305.name: Climbing The Great Pyramid
5305.description:
Here on the eastern side of the pyramid there is a little more shelter
from the heat and wind. The stone side is not nearly so slippery smooth
from the ravages of time, and you think you may be able to even reach
the top from here. The path is steep and treacherous. Bare rock
dominates the landscape.

north.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the northern side.

south.description: If you are daring you could try to skirt around to the southern side.

up.description: You see the apex of the pyramid many yards above you.

down.description: This side of the pyramid has a dangerous drop before the sandy floor.

5306.name: The Apex Of The Great Pyramid
5306.description:
Bathed in sweat, you have managed to reach the summit of the great
pyramid. The four sides of the pyramid slope sharply down into the hot
sands in all four cardinal directions. A plaque has been set into the
sandy stones beneath your feet. The sounds of city life echo around.
The cobblestones are worn smooth by countless feet.

north.description: The north side of the pyramid slopes down into the sands. It looks really dangerous.  I wouldn't go that way.

east.description: The east side of the pyramid slopes down into the sands.

south.description: The south side of the pyramid slopes down into the sands. It looks really dangerous.  I wouldn't go that way.

west.description: The west side of the pyramid slopes down into the sands. It looks really dangerous.  I wouldn't go that way.

down.description: You see some sandy stones pressed closely together to form a hard surface.

5307.name: On The Dangerous Stones
5307.description:
Here the elements have carved away at the sides of the pyramid quite a
bit. You aren't so sure of your footing anymore... Suddenly the wind
picks up, and you lose your balance! You tumble down the side of the
pyramid, and fall to your death! SPLAT. Ouch. Shadows gather in the
corners. The air is still and musty.

up.description: The apex of the pyramid is above.

5308.name: A Ladder
5308.description:
The area is climbing an ancient ladder that leads down into the depths
of the pyramid. The air around is thick with layers of dust and a
strange musty smell. above you see tiny beams of light coming through
the stones of the ceiling. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air is
still and musty.

up.description: You see the sandy stones of the ceiling.

down.description: You see a small dusty chamber.

5309.name: A Musty Chamber
5309.description:
This is a dank, musty chamber just inside the pyramid. Footprints and
other strange marks are set into the dusty floor here. It would seem
that some of the tenants of this monument are still alive. Exits lead in
all directions. The door to the west is covered with inscriptions.
Shadows gather in the corners. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch.

north.description: You see a tiny crawlway raised about three feet off the ground.

east.description: A dust-covered hallway leads off to the east.

south.description: You see a small crack in the wall through which you might be able to slide.

west.description: You see a large stone door, covered in sigils and hieroglyphs.

up.description: A small rickety ladder leads up.

5310.name: The Fire Pool
5310.description:
This room is dominated by a massive raised pool that is filled with not
water but flames of intense heat. The multicoloured flames lick out at
you, searching for things to burn. The pool proceeds to the east into a
small chamber. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air
is still and musty.

east.description: You see a large stone door.

west.description: You see a small chamber filled with fire.

5311.name: The Chamber Of The Efreet
5311.description:
You make your way across the fire pool, and into a small stone chamber.
Here the flames are nearly as high as your head, singeing your face and
evaporating your sweat instantaneously. The depths are dark and
unknowable. Waves crash and foam relentlessly.

east.description: The pool of fire ends to the east.

5312.name: A Tiny Crawlway
5312.description:
You have to go down onto your hands and knees to fit inside this tiny
space. The crawlway is thick with sand and dust, and markings of the
passage of other creatures. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes
drift in the stale air.

north.description: The crawlway continues to the north.

south.description: The crawlway ends to the south in a musty chamber.

up.description: A small hole above your head leads into a dank chamber.

5313.name: A Tiny Crawlway
5313.description:
The area is your hands and knees, inside a small crawlway that winds
through the inside of the pyramid. The crawlway is thick with sand,
dust, and markings of the passage of other creatures. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Shadows gather in the corners.

south.description: The crawlway continues to the south.

west.description: The crawlway continues to the west.

5314.name: A Tiny Crawlway
5314.description:
The area is your hands and knees, inside a small crawlway that winds
through the inside of the pyramid. The crawlway is thick with sand,
dust, and markings of the passage of other creatures. Dust motes drift
in the stale air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: The crawlway continues to the east.

west.description: The crawlway gets a little tighter to the west.

5315.name: A Tightening In The Crawlway
5315.description:
Here you are forced to slide on your belly through a particularly tight
section of the crawlway, as the stones of the pyramid close together
about you. below is a small, slippery-looking hole that plummets
into blackness. Dust motes drift in the stale air. Shadows gather in the
corners.

east.description: The crawlway gets a little larger to the east.

south.description: The crawlway continues to diminish in size to the south.

down.description: The hole looks very slippery and very dark.

5316.name: The Crawlway's End
5316.description:
The crawlway shrinks away to nothing as the sandy stones of the pyramid
close together into a space through which only a snake could fit. There
is barely enough space to turn around and make your way back through the
tiny crawlway to the north. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Shadows gather in the corners.

north.description: The crawlway gets a little larger to the north.

5317.name: A Slippery Hole
5317.description:
The sides of this hole are slippery-smooth. You lower yourself in, and
proceed to move downward... when suddenly you lose your purchase! You
fall for what seems like an eternity, and smash into the stones below...
Under The Hole You are in a small chamber underneath the slippery hole,
far below the pyramid now. The floor is strewn with bones. To the south
is a small rocky crevasse. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes
drift in the stale air.

south.description: You see a rocky crevasse that proceeds deep under the pyramid.

5318.name: Under The Hole
5318.description:
This is a small chamber underneath the slippery hole, far below the
pyramid now. The floor is strewn with bones. To the south is a small
rocky crevasse. Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

south.description: You see a rocky crevasse that proceeds deep under the pyramid.

5319.name: A Rough Crevasse
5319.description:
The area is now exploring deep within a strange rocky crevasse that
plunges down into the rock on which the pyramid was constructed. To the
south you see the flickering light of a fire, and the crevasse proceeds
downward. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch.

north.description: You see a small stone chamber littered with bones.

south.description: You see the flickering light of a small fire.

down.description: The crevasse continues downward into total darkness.

5320.name: A Small Fire
5320.description:
Here a small fire burns in a nook in the rocks, providing some warmth
and comforting light in the cold, dark, dry air. Standing here is a
strange-looking old man, who stares at you balefully. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see a massive crevasse that plunges into darkness.

5321.name: Down The Crevasse
5321.description:
The crevasse proceeds downward into the dark depths of the earth. The
air about you is now cold and quite dry, and your light source gutters
in a cool breeze that wafts up from below. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

up.description: It is too dark for you to see any further along the crevasse.

down.description: It is too dark for you to see any further along the crevasse.

5322.name: At The Crevasse's End
5322.description:
Here the crevasse comes to an abrupt end. A chilling wind howls at your
face from a black shape to the south, but the light from your source is
too dim to see exactly what it is. The air is still and musty. The
ceiling hangs low overhead.

south.description: You see a strange-looking black shape.

up.description: It is too dark for you to see anything along the crevasse.

5323.name: The Vault Of The Lamp
5323.description:
The jaws of the massive stone tiger part wide to reveal a great vault.
An arched ceiling lies far above your head... and all about you is a low
guttural rumbling noise and a chill wind. Giant heaps of ancient
treasure, gold coins, and valuables surround you on all sides. The air
is still and musty. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: Through the jaws of the tiger you see the blackness of the crevasse.

5324.name: A Crack In The Wall
5324.description:
You exhale, and squeeze yourself into the narrow crack in the wall. Dust
fills your eyes as you disturb it, and chunks of mortar and stone mixed
with a touch of sand fall on you as you scrape your way through. Dust
motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.

north.description: You see a musty chamber.

south.description: You see a tomb.

5325.name: A Looted Tomb
5325.description:
The floor of this small tomb is littered with the lids of smashed
sarcophagi, bits of treasure dropped by thieves and looters, and corpses
pulled from their resting places. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
Shadows gather in the corners.

north.description: You see a small crack in the wall through which you might be able to slide.

east.description: To the east is another tomb.

west.description: To the west is another tomb.

5326.name: A Demolished Tomb
5326.description:
This tomb has been utterly destroyed by thieves and looters in search of
the treasures of the pharoahs. Nothing of interest remains in this room,
except a large stone coffin that leans against the western wall. The air
is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

east.description: To the east is another tomb.

west.description: You see a large stone coffin.

5327.name: A Stairway
5327.description:
The area opens now at the head of a stairway that goes down into
darkness. The steps and walls are smooth sandy stone, covered with a
thick layer of dust. Some inscriptions are carved into the wall here.
The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

east.description: You see the backside of the coffin lid, featureless stone.

down.description: It is too dark to see down the stairway.

5328.name: A Stairway
5328.description:
The area is a stairway that disappears into darkness in both directions.
The smooth, uneven steps of the stairway have not been travelled in what
appears to be centuries. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is
still and musty.

up.description: It is too dark to see up the stairway.

down.description: It is too dark to see down the stairway.

5329.name: A Stairway
5329.description:
The area opens now at the base of the uneven stairway. The walls, floor,
and ceiling of this small landing are covered with strange
hieroglyphics. The ceiling hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the
stale air.

south.description: You see a seam in the stone wall.

up.description: It is too dark to see up the stairway.

5330.name: The Ancient Hall
5330.description:
Here the air is deathly still, motes of dust thickly obscuring your
vision. Several stone statues line the walls of the hall, depicting the
gods of an ancient society. Strange glyphs and sigils cover the walls, a
peculiar pictorial form of written language that you don't understand.
Some steps lead to a raised dais to the south. The air is still and
musty. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

north.description: You see a seam in the stone wall.

south.description: You see a small raised dais.

5331.name: A Raised Dais
5331.description:
This is the southern end of the ancient hall, the dust and darkness
absorbing your light so that you cannot see past the steps of the dais.
A low pedestal rests here. You see something written into the face of
it. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air is still and musty.

north.description: You cannot see past the steps of the dais.

down.description: You see a seam in the stone floor.

5332.name: The Tomb Of Ramses
5332.description:
The area opens in an empty tomb, a cubicle no more then ten feet to a
side. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The ceiling hangs low overhead.
The air is stale and the walls close. Shadows pool in the corners,
undisturbed.

up.description: That leads back the way you came.

5333.name: A Ransacked Tomb
5333.description:
This tomb has been completely ransacked and destroyed by the actions of
pyramid thieves and looters. The floor is littered with junk. The
ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is still and musty.

east.description: To the east is a low-ceilinged tunnel.

west.description: To the west is another tomb.

5334.name: A Tunnel
5334.description:
Ancient stone blocks form the walls of this narrow tunnel, each carved
with hieroglyphs that glow faintly in the darkness. The air is stale and
heavy with the weight of millennia, and sand sifts down from hidden
cracks above. The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and
cold to the touch.

east.description: You cannot see into the darkness of the low tunnel.

west.description: You see a tomb.

5335.name: A Fork In The Tunnel
5335.description:
Here the tunnel forks off through a gaping hole down in the southern
wall, continuing onward to the east and west as well. Dust motes drift
in the stale air. The air is still and musty.

east.description: You cannot see into the darkness of the low tunnel.

west.description: You cannot see into the darkness of the low tunnel.

down.description: Through the hole you see rubble and sand.

5336.name: A Tunnel
5336.description:
The low-ceilinged tunnel makes a turn to the west and ends to the north
as it spills out into a dusty hallway. Dust motes drift in the stale
air. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: The mouth of the tunnel is stone that has been torn away by looters.

west.description: You cannot see into the darkness of the low tunnel.

5337.name: A Dank Chamber
5337.description:
This chamber has a dank, dusty, musty smell to it. Small footprints in
the dust betray the recent passage of some sort of creatures. A hole in
the floor lies to the west and a stairway is to the east. The ceiling
hangs low overhead. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

east.description: You see a spiral stone stairway.

west.description: You see only blackness through the hole in the floor.

5338.name: A Spiral Stairway
5338.description:
Some dusty, broken stone stairs here spiral slowly in a constricted
space down towards a dusty hallway. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The
walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

up.description: The stairs spiral up into a dank chamber.

down.description: The stairs spiral down into a dusty hallway.

5339.name: A Dust-Covered Hallway
5339.description:
This hallway is covered with dust that has accumulated over the
centuries that the pyramid has stood. Small markings and footprints in
the dust betray the recent passage of others -- perhaps thieves? Dust
motes drift in the stale air. Shadows gather in the corners.

east.description: The hallway proceeds to the east towards a strange smell.

west.description: The hallway proceeds towards the west towards a musty smell.

5340.name: A Smelly Chamber
5340.description:
This small chamber has a sickly putrescent smell to it, the smell of
formaldehyde and other ointments used to preserve the corpses of those
who died ages ago. The air is still and musty. The ceiling hangs low
overhead.

east.description: You see a dusty hallway.

west.description: You a dusty hallway.

5341.name: A Dust-Covered Hallway
5341.description:
This hallway is covered with a thick, choking dust that rises up to
obscure your light source and sting your eyes. Small marks and
footprints in the dust betray the recent passage of others. Dust motes
drift in the stale air. Shadows gather in the corners.

east.description: The hallway turns to the north.

west.description: You smell something peculiar over there.

up.description: A tightly spiralling stone stairway leads up.

5342.name: A Turn In The Hallway
5342.description:
This is an elbow turn in a dust-covered stone hallway, that dead ends to
the north and continues on to the west. To the south the stones of the
pyramid have been torn asunder by thieves, making a low- ceilinged
tunnel. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. Dust motes drift
in the stale air.

north.description: The hallway ends to the north.

south.description: The tunnel is dark.

west.description: The dust-covered hallway continues to the west.

5343.name: A Dead End
5343.description:
The dust-covered hallway has come to an abrupt end at a stony,
featureless wall. Here and there are signs of the recent passage of
others in the dust. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.
Shadows gather in the corners.

south.description: The dusty hall continues to the south.

down.description: The floor is quite dusty, and made of stone.  You see some cracks.

5344.name: The Tomb Entrance
5344.description:
This is a small, dark chamber that has stood undisturbed for many years.
To the north stands a massive stone tomb, which is covered in
hieroglyphics and gold-lined carvings that mark it as the final resting
place of the mighty pharoahs of this land. Shadows gather in the
corners. The air is still and musty.

north.description: You see the tomb of the pharoahs.

up.description: The stone ceiling has some cracks in it, through which a dim light streams.

5345.name: The Tomb Of The Pharoahs
5345.description:
Great golden sarcophogai line the walls of this massive tomb. It has
withstood the passage of time intact, untouched by the hands of thieves
and looters. The treasures taken by the pharoahs to their graves still
lie before your feet. The air is still and musty. The walls are rough-
hewn and cold to the touch.

south.description: That way leads back out of the tomb.

5346.name: A Rubble-Strewn Hallway
5346.description:
This hallway formerly had a beautiful arch to the ceiling, now collapsed
under the weight of the slowly settling stones of the pyramid. Now, a
massive pile of rubble leads up into a hole high in the northern portion
of the hallway. To the south, through the rubble and fallen stones you
see a sandstone crypt. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.
Dust motes drift in the stale air.

south.description: You see a sandstone crypt.

up.description: From here you see only darkness.

5347.name: A Sandstone Crypt
5347.description:
This small crypt is lit by a hole in the wall to the south, through
which sand pours from the desert outside. A hot wind blows in from the
desert, drying your skin instantly. To the east and north the arched
hallway continues. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The
air is still and musty.

north.description: The arched hallway collapses into rubble shortly to the north.

east.description: You see a beautifully arched hallway.

south.description: You see a lot of sand.

5348.name: An Arched Hall
5348.description:
This hallway has a beautiful arch to it, formed painstakingly and
exquisitely out of the sandy stones of the pyramid. The dust that covers
most of the rest of the pyramid interior is not present here, scoured
away by the blowing of the desert winds that howl about your ears. Dust
motes drift in the stale air. The air is still and musty.

east.description: The arched hall proceeds to the east, making a sharp southward turn.

west.description: The arched hall proceeds into a sandstone crypt.

5349.name: An Arched Hall
5349.description:
This hallway has a beautiful arch to it, formed painstakingly and
exquisitely out of the sandy stones of the pyramid. To the east is a
small, golden-coloured crypt, and the hall proceeds to the south and
north. Shadows gather in the corners. The walls are rough-hewn and cold
to the touch.

north.description: The arched hall proceeds to the north, making a sharp westward turn.

east.description: A small golden crypt lies to the east.

south.description: The arched hall proceeds to the south.

5350.name: A Golden Crypt
5350.description:
The area opens inside a small crypt with walls and ceiling made of
golden bricks that obscure the large sandy stones of the pyramid. Small
rugs and tapestries are scattered about the floor here, and they appear
to have been used recently. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The walls
are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

west.description: You see an arched hall.

5351.name: An Arched Hall
5351.description:
This hallway has a beautiful arch to it, formed painstakingly and
exquisitely out of the sandy stones of the pyramid. The arched hall
proceeds to the north and ends to the south in a small vault. The air is
still and musty. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

north.description: The arched hall continues to the north.

south.description: You see a small vault from which a shining light issues.

5352.name: A Shining Vault
5352.description:
The stones of the pyramid here take on a strange, twinkling quality,
almost seeming to shine with an internal light. As you look closer you
see tiny glass-like glittery particles within the stones, that reflect
the light from your light source so perfectly that they seem to shine.
Shadows gather in the corners. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

north.description: You see a hall with a beautifully arched ceiling.

5353.name: A Massive Sand Dune
5353.description:
The area opens now on a massive sand dune on the southern side of the
pyramid. At the foot of the sand dune to the north you see a small hole
where the stones of the pyramid have collapsed. Not far to the south is
a massive roiling sandstorm; the wind from the storm howls and bites at
your face even here. The ground is soft underfoot. The open sky
stretches overhead.

north.description: You see a small hole leading back into the pyramid.

south.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

5354.name: A Swirling Sandstorm
5354.description:
The area is caught in the midst of a massive sandstorm. Howling winds
buffet you from all sides, and the sand tears at your skin, blinding you
and choking you. You have lost all sense of direction. Wildflowers dot
the landscape. The air is fresh and clean.

north.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

east.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

south.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

west.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

5355.name: A Swirling Sandstorm
5355.description:
The area is caught in the midst of a massive sandstorm. Howling winds
buffet you from all sides, and the sand tears at your skin, blinding you
and choking you. You have lost all sense of direction. The ground is
soft underfoot. The air is fresh and clean.

north.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

east.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

south.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

west.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

5356.name: A Swirling Sandstorm
5356.description:
The area is caught in the midst of a massive sandstorm. Howling winds
buffet you from all sides, and the sand tears at your skin, blinding you
and choking you. You have lost all sense of direction. Tall grass sways
in a gentle breeze. The open sky stretches overhead.

north.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

east.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

south.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

west.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

5357.name: A Swirling Sandstorm
5357.description:
The area is caught in the midst of a massive sandstorm. Howling winds
buffet you from all sides, and the sand tears at your skin, blinding you
and choking you. You have lost all sense of direction. Tall grass sways
in a gentle breeze. The air is fresh and clean.

north.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

east.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

south.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

west.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

5358.name: A Massive Sand Dune
5358.description:
Somehow you managed to make your way through the howling winds of the
sandstorm, and clamber up on this sand dune. Visible is the storm to the
to the north, and presumably the pyramid is somewhere beyond it. Nothing
but flat, featureless, open dunes of sand lie in every other direction.
The open sky stretches overhead. Wildflowers dot the landscape.

north.description: You see only a wall of whirling, blowing, dry sand.

south.description: On the southern side of the sand dune is a small hole in the sand. For some reason you seem unable to get to it.

5359.name: Through The Hole In The Sand
5359.description:
You squeeze through the small hole in the sand and land in a small white
chamber. above is a small hole, reachable by climbing up the small
sandy slope down which you slid. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to
the touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

up.description: You see a sand dune.

down.description: The way leads to Bronze Dragon Lair

5360.name: Bronze Dragon Lair
5360.description:
A towering bronze dragon lies amid ancient relics and gleaming armor.
The air crackles with static, and the walls hum with old magic. The
floor is slick with moisture. The stone walls press close, cold and
damp.

up.description: A passage leads to Through The Hole In The Sand

5300.name: asp
5300.long_desc: A small, poisonous asp slithers over your feet.
5300.description:
The asp is a small, smooth-scaled snake the color of worn pottery.
The poison bite of this snake has felled many a mighty pharoah.

5301.name: cobra
5301.long_desc: A cobra snake rears up and opens its fearsome hood.
5301.description:
The cobra snake waves back and forth before you, its hood displaying brilliant
colors designed to serve notice to its prey that it is about to strike.

5302.name: mongoose
5302.long_desc: A small mongoose slinks along the ground, hunting snakes.
5302.description:
The mongoose is a wily rodent, a quick hunter of nasty poisonous snakes.
She sniffs you and appears to be looking for food in your hand.

5303.name: pyramid
5303.long_desc: The pyramid watcher protects the tombs from intruders.
5303.description:
The pyramid watcher has made a pledge to destroy any would-be looters of
the tombs of the pharoahs.  He is clad from head to foot in utilitarian
sand-colored clothing.

5304.name: thief
5304.long_desc: A sneaky tomb thief moves about in search of treasure.
5304.description: The thief brushes against you briefly, then slinks back into the shadows.

5305.name: ali
5305.long_desc: Ali Baba is here, hunting for the pharoah's tomb.
5305.description:
You see a tall, full-bearded man with a mischevious glint in his eye.  Ali Baba
has made his life from stealing things from others, including many items stolen
recently from under the nose of the hapless guardians of this pyramid.  Someday
he might get caught, but not today...

5306.name: magic
5306.long_desc: A small woven carpet lies under your feet.
5306.description:
The carpet is simply beautiful, made from intricately woven silken material.  
It seems to rise up at the touch of your feet.  Wait, it is rising, a few feet
above the ground!  In fact, it seems to be ALIVE!

5307.name: mummy
5307.long_desc: A mummy reaches for you, disturbed by your presence.
5307.description:
You only see the disfigured, rotting features of decaying human flesh,
animated by the distempered spirit of a long-deceased person.

5308.name: sand
5308.long_desc: A sandman rises up from the desert floor.
5308.description:
The sandman is exactly that -- some sort of strange being formed from the sands
of the desert floor.  It seems quite large and strong and at home in the heat
and sandy winds.

5309.name: efreeti
5309.long_desc: The efreeti stands here, sheathed in a column of fire.
5309.description:
The efreeti is a mighty being formed from living fire.  He gazes down at
you with disdain and scorn, arms folded across his mighty chest.

5310.name: caryatid
5310.long_desc: A sandstone column stands here, carved into a feminine figure.
5310.description:
The column has been carved into a set of four shapely women, each facing
outward into the room.  The sandstone of the caryatid is smooth with age,
but you can still make out a deadly stone sword in the hands of each figure.

5311.name: djinn
5311.long_desc: The djinn issues forth from the confines of a small lamp.
5311.description:
The djinn is a mighty being formed from the air itself and frequently
imprisoned in a small lamp, used to do the bidding of those who find him.
He smiles down at you congenially, arms folded across his blue-tinged 
skin, and strokes his goatee.

5312.name: hieracosphinx
5312.long_desc: A hieracosphinx looks at you cunningly.
5312.description:
The hieracosphinx are cunning, small, but nasty creatures, having the heads
of birds, mighty wingspans, and a full set of four paws to rend their victims
to pieces.  They tend to be quite jealous of the sharper wits of their older
cousins.

5313.name: gynosphinx
5313.long_desc: A gynosphinx sits here, befuddled by a riddle.
5313.description:
The gynosphinx is a crafty but gentle creature, having the body of a
beautiful dark-skinned woman from the waist up, a feathery set of wings
and the hind legs of a mighty cat.  Right now she is confused, having 
just heard a puzzling riddle from a cousin criosphinx.

5314.name: criosphinx
5314.description:
The criosphinx is a calm and friendly creature, having the head of a ram atop
the body of a well-furred feline with eagle-like wings.  He delights in riddles,
and in poking occasional fun at his easily confused lesser cousins.

5315.name: androsphinx
5315.long_desc: A mighty androsphinx tosses its lion-like mane.
5315.description:
The mighty androsphinx is a huge creature, with the body of a lion whose
face  is quite man-like, perhaps even handsome, and a massive pair of feathered
wings.  Tales are told of pharoahs that were rendered permanently deaf by the 
mighty roar of this sphinx.

5316.name: great
5316.long_desc: A mighty sphinx rests here in the sand, dormant now for centuries.
5316.description:
The great sphinx towers tens of feet above you, resting here in a state of 
dormancy.  It has become almost indistinguishable from the sand that surrounds
it, although you can still make out the features of the handsome face that once
advised many rulers.

5317.name: ramses
5317.long_desc: You have awakened the mighty servant to the pharoahs, Ramses.
5317.description:
As your light spills over his face and body, you can see his features
begin to fill out, swell, and harden, until an apparently healthy man 
stands before you, clad only in the raiments he was left in when he last 
slept.  His hair is a soft black, his skin a deep chocolate, and his 
tall frame is totally still, his chest not even moving to breathe.

5318.name: the Necromancer
5318.long_desc: A necromancer wrapped in black robes mutters in an ancient tongue.

phases.message: The Necromancer tears open a grave portal!
The Necromancer fades into shadow and reappears with a howl!

abilities.name: Drain Life
abilities.telegraph: The Necromancer begins a dark siphoning chant!
abilities.on_success_message: Dark energy pours into the Necromancer!

abilities.name: Shadow Nova
abilities.telegraph: The Necromancer spreads his arms, shadow building to a burst!

5360.name: Aurexus the Bronze Dragon
5360.long_desc: A bronze dragon watches you with ancient, storm-lit eyes.

phases.message: Aurexus beats its wings, storm winds roaring!

abilities.name: Lightning Breath
abilities.telegraph: Aurexus draws lightning into its maw!

abilities.name: Thunderclap
abilities.telegraph: Aurexus slams the ground in a thunderous clap!

5398.name: tomb robber
5398.long_desc: A tomb robber hides here in a shadowy alcove, clutching a half-empty sack.
5398.description: He's lean and wiry, dressed in dark wrappings that blend with the pyramid's shadows. His fingers are stained with ancient dust and his eyes dart constantly to every sound.

talk_responses.hello: The tomb robber hisses. 'Keep your voice down! The deeper chambers have pressure plates — step on the wrong stone and the ceiling comes down. I lost my partner that way. Also, the mummies... they don't stay dead. Burn them if you can.'
talk_responses.traps: He traces a pattern in the dust. 'The builders were clever. Look for discolored stones — those are usually triggers. And never touch golden sarcophagi directly. Always check for needles in the lid seams.'
talk_responses.default: The tomb robber eyes you warily. 'You didn't see me here. I wasn't here. Got it?'
talk_responses.next: The tomb robber's eyes gleam with fear and greed. 'The Necropolis makes this tomb look like a children's playground. Seek Paladin Dawnguard there if you dare. And I've heard whispers of a Frostspire in the frozen north — ancient magic and terrible cold.'

5399.name: ghostly servant
5399.long_desc: The translucent shade of a pharaoh's servant drifts here, endlessly sweeping with a spectral broom.
5399.description: Its form flickers like a candle in the wind. Ancient linen wrappings trail behind it, and its hollow eyes stare through you as if seeing another time entirely.

talk_responses.hello: The ghost pauses its eternal sweeping. 'The master sleeps... but not peacefully. His tomb was sealed with blood and bone. Those who disturb his rest join his court — forever. The pharaoh's curse is not metaphor, traveler. It is promise.'
talk_responses.pharaoh: The ghost's voice echoes. 'He was a god among men, and cruel as the desert sun. Even death could not humble him. His treasure room lies in the deepest chamber, but the way is guarded by those who served him in life... and now in death.'
talk_responses.default: The ghostly servant resumes sweeping, murmuring in a forgotten language.

5300.name: mace
5300.room_desc: A hierogylph-engraved mace has been left here.

5302.name: dirk
5302.room_desc: A flat dirk made of chipped obsidian lies here.

5303.name: turban
5303.room_desc: A dirty cloth turban has been forgotten here.

5304.name: wrappings
5304.room_desc: Long cloth wrappings lie on the ground in a pile.

5305.name: bottle
5305.room_desc: A dusty bottle lies here on the ground.

5306.name: jar
5306.room_desc: A small jar lies here on the ground.

5307.name: ball
5307.short_desc: a small hot ball of fire
5307.room_desc: A little ball of fire hovers in the air before your eyes.

5308.name: scimitar
5308.room_desc: A curved scimitar made of stone rests on the ground.

5309.name: key
5309.room_desc: A stone key has been dropped here.

5310.name: sarcophagus
5310.room_desc: A mighty stone sarcophagus lies in the center of the tomb.

5311.name: dust
5311.room_desc: A small pile of dust is being scattered by the breeze.

5312.name: scarab
5312.room_desc: A small emerald scarab lies here on the ground.

5313.name: lamp
5313.room_desc: A small, tarnished, battered lamp has been dropped here.

5314.name: ankh
5314.room_desc: A small brass ankh has been left here.

5315.name: book
5315.room_desc: A medium-sized parchment book with well-worn pages lies here.

5316.name: paw
5316.room_desc: The mighty paw of a lion-like creature has been dropped here.

5317.name: parchment
5317.room_desc: A small piece of parchment covered in hieroglyphics lies here.

5318.name: treasure
5318.room_desc: The massive treasure of the sphinx lies here in a big pile.

5319.name: sand
5319.room_desc: You see a small pile of sand.

5320.name: golden armor of the pharaoh
5320.description: Ancient golden armor inscribed with hieroglyphs.

5321.name: pharaoh's crown
5321.description: A crown of the ancient pharaohs.

5324.name: wand
5324.room_desc: A small length of brass pipe shines here with its own light.

5325.name: ring
5325.room_desc: A small sandy-coloured ring has been carelessly dropped here.

5326.name: sphinx
5326.room_desc: A small golden sphinx glints in the light.

5327.name: leggings
5327.room_desc: Massive leggings formed from the body of a sphinx stand here.

5328.name: a necromancer staff
5328.room_desc: A blackwood staff hums with dark power.

5329.name: a bone-etched grimoire
5329.room_desc: A grimoire bound in bone lies here.

5330.name: a shroud of the crypt
5330.room_desc: A shroud woven from shadowy cloth rests here.

9201.name: aegis of the tempest
9201.room_desc: [33mA bronze [93mAegis[0m[33m crackling with static lies here.[0m
9201.description: A paladin’s shield forged in stormfire.

9202.name: stormcaller reliquary
9202.room_desc: [33mA [93mreliquary[0m[33m etched with lightning sigils rests here.[0m
9202.description: A cleric’s relic humming with divine thunder.

9203.name: scale of the bronze dragon
9203.room_desc: [33mA bronze dragon scale lies here, warm with stormlight.[0m

53090.name: boots of the bronze whisper
53090.room_desc: [93mA pair of bronze‑stitched boots rests here.[0m
53090.description: Soft‑soled boots that hush each step like distant thunder.

53091.name: stormblessed signet
53091.description: A signet that channels holy thunder into your smite.

53092.name: auric clasp
53092.description: A clasp that strengthens the spell Heal.

53093.name: sunward sigil
53093.description: A sigil that empowers holy smite.
